definition: plain/informal/suitable/convenient/opportune/to urinate or defecate/equivalent to 就[jiu4]: then/in that case/even if/soon afterwards
member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker

sentences.english: Fourpence was a private soldier's daily pay at that time.
sentences.chinese: 当时二等兵每天的工资是四便士。

sentences.english: They make believe to be generous, but they gave him only two-pence.
sentences.chinese: 他们装出十分慷慨的样子，但只给了两便士。
欧洲迪斯尼的股票价格迅速上涨了17便士。

sentences.english: Minority shareholders will also be offered ordinary shares, at 1p.
sentences.chinese: 小股东们也将提供每股1便士的普通股。

sentences.english: Supermarkets can afford to retail cigarettes at a couple of cents below the price charged by most tobacconists.
sentences.chinese: 超市能以比大多数烟商低几便士的价格出售香烟。

sentences.english: To reduce pounds to pence you multiply by a hundred.
sentences.chinese: 镑乘以一百就折合成便士。

sentences.english: Never a month but I've given you a silver fourpenny for yourself.
sentences.chinese: 我月月不落地给你个四便士的角子。

sentences.english: Let's toss up a penny for the chance to go first.
sentences.chinese: 我们掷一枚一便士的硬币来决定谁先去。

sentences.english: With one penny Ihad this peculiar pen opened.
sentences.chinese: 我花了一便士让人把这支奇特的钢笔翻开了。

sentences.english: It was certainly the best 40p worth of entertainment I have had in a long time.
sentences.chinese: 这是我很久以来花40便士买到的最超值的娱乐。

sentences.english: Sing a song of sixpence, a pocket full of rye.
sentences.chinese: 唱六便士之歌，口袋里装满了稞麦饼。

sentences.english: He has twenty-four buttons and three pennies!
sentences.chinese: 他有二十四粒钮扣，有三个便士。

sentences.english: Tis a well spent penny that saves a groat.
sentences.chinese: 善花一便士，节约四便士。

sentences.english: Tis a well spent penny that saves a groat.
sentences.chinese: 善花一便士，节约四便士。
是的，来一张25便士的邮政汇单。

sentences.english: Then I asked for a three-penny loaf, and was told they had none such.
sentences.chinese: 于是我就要买三便士的长条面包，可他们说没有。

pinyin: Sha1 kui2 er3 · Ao4 ni2 er3
